con:soapui-project.name: Conformance Class: Download Service - Pre-defined Atom
con:soapui-project.con:description:
This test suite examines a Atom feed with Open Search description against the requirements related to the INSPIRE Pre-Defined Atom Download Service feed with sub-feeds for data sets. This test suite only examines requirements that are specific to a Pre-Defined Atom Download Service feed.

The test suite is divided into four test modules. In the first module 'Initialization and basic checks', basic queries are send to the Atom feed to ensure the endpoints are available. The 'Download Service Feed', 'Dataset Feed' and 'OpenSearch Description' test modules contain the actual test cases, derived from the Abstract Test Cases. If a test case in the first module fails, the three other modules are skipped!

There are a few test cases and test steps that are marked as 'technical test step' or 'technical test case' in the description. They are used to control the test execution flow of the steps. The description text of a technical test step indicates the test steps that are executed. If a technical test step fails, the other test steps, which have been called by the technical test step, should be checked first. To examine a reported issue, the assertion messages should be compared with the service responses which are included in the report. If the response contains an exception report, the request should be checked for 'incorrect' parameters (i.e. non-existing IDs). The test step description should refer to a point, from where the information has been gathered (i.e. from a previous request where the ID was listed).

Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion.

Source: Conformance Class 'Pre-defined Atom'

con:testSuite.name: Initialization and basic checks
con:testSuite.con:description:
Perform basic check to ensure the top-level Download Service Feed is available and initialize the Executable Test Suite with gathered information.
If this test case fails, all other test cases will be skipped! Ensure that the schema locations and all endpoints can be queried!
Please note that for technical reasons this Executable Test Suite requires that schema locations must be accessible without any authentication mechanism.

con:testCase.name: Setup credentials and check if endpoint is available
con:testCase.con:description: Technical test case. Initialize loggers and set credentials for the test run.

con:assertion.name: No invalid characters before XML prolog

con:testCase.name: Basic checks passed and Feed still accessible
con:testCase.con:description: Check if the feed is available and the Test initialisation phase has been completed successfully.

con:testSuite.name: Download Service Feed
con:testSuite.con:description:
Test module for checking the top-level Download Service Feed.

Known limitations: Response schema validation is not implemented yet.

con:testCase.name: Contact information
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if the response contains the author name and email address.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 12: The 'author' element of a feed shall contain current contact information for an individual or organisation responsible for the feed. At the minimum, a name and email address shall be provided as contact information.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed contact information'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the contact information.

con:testCase.name: CRS information
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each feed entry contain an Atom 'category' element for each CRS.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 20: Each feed entry shall contain an Atom 'category' element for each CRS in which the pre-defined dataset is available. This category element shall refer to a well-known definition of a coordinate reference system.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed CRS information'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the CRS information.

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element category, including a term and label, to refer to CRSs.

con:testCase.name: Dataset identifiers
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each dataset has an INSPIRE Spatial Dataset Unique Resource Identifier 'dataset identifier code' and a 'dataset identifier namespace'.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 13: Each feed 'entry' in a 'Download Service Feed' shall contain spatial_dataset_identifier_code and spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace elements which together contain the Spatial Dataset Unique Resource Identifier for the dataset described by the feed. These elements are defined in the inspire_dls schema which shall be included in the namespace declarations of the feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed dataset identifiers'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the dataset identifiers.

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element INSPIRE identifier code
Each entry has an element INSPIRE identifier element namespace

con:testCase.name: HTTP URI
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if provides the HTTP URI of the feed as ID.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 9: The 'id' element of a feed shall contain an HTTP URI which dereferences to the feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed: id'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the feed URL.

con:config.name: Get Service Feed by ID
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the feed URL.

con:configuration.scriptText:
import de.interactive_instruments.etf.suim.* import de.interactive_instruments.xtf.* SOAPUI_I.init(log, context, messageExchange) final ProjectHelper ph = new ProjectHelper() final Assert a = new Assert(messageExchange, context, log, Assert.INSPIRE_DS_NS);
a.equals( "/atom:feed/atom:id", "/atom:feed/atom:id", messageExchange.getEndpoint(), "TR.feedIdDoesNotReferToEndpoint" );

con:assertion.name: Response equals response from test step 'Get Service Feed'

con:testCase.name: Identifiers
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each feed entry provides the HTTP URI of the feed as ATOM ID.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 17: The 'id' element of a feed entry in a Download Service Feed shall contain an identifier for that feed entry.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed identifiers'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks each feed entry ID.

con:testCase.name: Link to OpenSearch Description document
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it provides a link to an 'OpenSearch Description document' and if the it can be retrieved.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 8: The 'Download Service Feed' shall contain an Atom 'link' element that contains a link to an OpenSearch description document for the Download Service. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'search', the 'hreflang' attribute shall use the appropriate language code and the value of the 'type' attribute shall be 'application/opensearchdescription+xml'.
  • TG Requirement 39: A simple service to perform the Describe Spatial Dataset and Get Spatial Data Set operations shall be provided and described by an OpenSearch description document.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed: link OpenSearch Description document'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks OpenSearch description.

con:assertion.name: Feed link to OpenSearch Description Document exists

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:testCase.name: Link to WFS Capabilities document
con:testCase.con:description:
In case of a 'hybrid implementation' using WFS for implementing direct access: check manually that the download service feed includes a link to the WFS Capabilities document with the "rel" attribute set to "related" and the "type" attribute set to "application/xml".

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 16: In case of a 'hybrid implementation' based on Atom for Part A of [INS NS, Annex IV] and WFS for Parts B and C of [INS NS, Annex IV], a link shall be provided to the WFS Capabilities document. Where this is done the 'rel' attribute shall have the value 'related' and the 'type' attribute shall have the value 'application/xml'


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed: link to WFS Capabilities document'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed to let the Tester check a link to the WFS Capabilities, if the same data set is available as a WFS 2.0.0 Direct Access Download Service.

con:assertion.name: Check link to WFS Capabilities document

con:testCase.name: Links dataset metadata records
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each feed entry has a link to a Dataset metadata record.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 14: Each feed 'entry' in a 'Download Service Feed' shall contain a link to a Dataset metadata record. This link shall have a 'rel' attribute with a value of 'describedby' and a 'type' attribute with a value 'application/xml'


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed links dataset metadata records'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset metadata links are set.

con:assertion.name: Link to Dataset Metadata record exists

con:testCase.name: Rights element
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it has a rights element.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 10: The 'rights' element of a feed shall contain information about rights or restrictions for that feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed rights element'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the it provides rights information.

con:testCase.name: Self-reference link
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it provides a self-reference link.

TODO: The ATS states that hreflang should be compared to /atom:feed/atom:title/@xml:lang . This seems inappropriate -at least an additional comparison against /atom:feed/@xml:lang is required.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 7: The 'Download Service Feed' shall contain an Atom 'link' element that contains an HTTP URI for the 'Download Service Feed' document. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'self', the 'hreflang' attribute shall use the appropriate language code and the value of the 'type' attribute shall be 'application/atom+xml'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed: self-reference link'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the self-refernce link is correct.

con:assertion.name: Self reference equals the Download Service feed URI

con:configuration.scriptText:
import de.interactive_instruments.etf.suim.* import de.interactive_instruments.xtf.* SOAPUI_I.init(log, context, messageExchange) final ProjectHelper ph = new ProjectHelper() final Assert a = new Assert(messageExchange, context, log, Assert.INSPIRE_DS_NS);
a.equals( "/atom:feed/atom:link[@rel='self' and @type='application/atom+xml']/@href", "/atom:feed/atom:link with @rel='self'", messageExchange.getEndpoint(), "TR.incorrectFeedSelfReference" );

con:assertion.name: Self link has proper language references

con:testCase.name: Title
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it each entry has a title.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 18: The 'title' element of a feed entry in a Download Service Feed shall be populated with a human readable title for the feed entry.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed: entry titles'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the title is set for each feed entry.

con:testCase.name: Updated feed element date
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each feed entry provides a 'updated' element.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 19: The 'updated' element of a feed entry in a Download Service Feed shall contain the date, time and timezone at which the feed entry was last updated.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed updated element date'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if provides update information.

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element updated
Date is not before the year 2012
Date is not in the future

con:testCase.name: Updated element
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it provides a 'updated' element.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 11: The 'updated' element of a feed shall contain the date, time and timezone at which the feed was last updated.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed updated element'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if each title has an element 'updated'.

con:assertion.name: Date is not before the year 2012
Date is not in the future

con:testCase.name: Provide a title element
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it provides a 'title' element.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 5: The 'title' element of an Atom feed shall be populated with a human readable title for the feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download service feed: Provide a title element'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if it provides a title.

con:testCase.name: Separate entries per dataset
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks that each each dataset has a separate entry in the service feed.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 1: Pre-defined Dataset Download Service implementations shall publish separate datasets as individual entries within an Atom feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download service feed: separate entries per dataset'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks that each each dataset has a separate entry in the service feed.

con:assertion.name: Dataset identifiers (spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace + spatial_dataset_identifier_code combination) are unique

con:testCase.name: Links dataset feed
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if each feed entry contains exactly one dataset feed link with a 'rel' attribute with the value 'alternate' and a 'type' attribute with the 'value' 'application/atom+xml'.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 15: Each feed 'entry' in a 'Download Service Feed' shall contain a single link to a 'Dataset Feed'. This link shall have a 'rel' attribute with a value of 'alternate' and a 'type' attribute with a value 'application/atom+xml'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download Service feed links dataset feed'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:assertion.name: Each entry has exactly one Dataset Feed link

con:testCase.name: Provide link to metadata record for download service
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the Download Service feed and checks if it provides a link to a metadata record.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 6: The 'Download Service Feed' shall contain an Atom 'link' element that links to the metadata record for this Download Service. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'describedby' and the value of the 'type' attribute shall be either 'application/xml'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Download service feed: Provide link to metadata record for the download service'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks that the metadata record for the download service exists.

con:assertion.name: Link to metadata record for the download service exists

con:config.name: Get Metadata Record
con:config.con:description: Requests the metadata record from the Service Feed.

con:testStep.name: Get Service Feed from Resource Locator

con:config.name: Get Service Feed from Resource Locator
con:config.con:description: Requests the document from the Resource Locator and compares the describedby link from the 'Get Service Feed' step with the describedby link from this response.

con:assertion.name: The describedby link from the first response equals the describedby from this response

con:testSuite.name: Dataset Feed
con:testSuite.con:description:
Test module for checking the Dataset Feeds that are referenced by the Download Service Feed.

Known limitations: Response schema validation is not implemented yet.

con:testCase.name: Check all Feed entries
con:testCase.con:description: Technical Test Case which iterates over all Dataset feed entries in the Download Service Feed. This test case requires the Test Case 'Links dataset feed' in the 'Download Service Feed' Test Suite to pass.

con:testStep.name: Each feed entry contains a single dataset feed link

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the contact information.

con:testCase.name: Contact information
con:testCase.con:description:
Checks that the feed provides contact information about the individual or organisation responsible for the feed. The author name and email address must be provided.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 25: The 'author' element of a 'Dataset Feed' shall contain current contact information for an individual or organisation responsible for the feed. At the minimum, a name and email address shall be provided as contact information.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Dataset feed contact information'

con:testCase.name: HTTP URI
con:testCase.con:description:
Checks that dataset feed provides the HTTP URI of the feed as feed id.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 22: The 'id' element of a 'Dataset Feed' shall contain an HTTP URI which dereferences to the feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Dataset feed HTTP URI'

con:configuration.scriptText:
import de.interactive_instruments.etf.suim.* import de.interactive_instruments.xtf.* SOAPUI_I.init(log, context, messageExchange) final ProjectHelper ph = new ProjectHelper() final Assert a = new Assert(messageExchange, context, log, Assert.INSPIRE_DS_NS);
a.equals( "/atom:feed/atom:id", "/atom:feed/atom:id", messageExchange.getEndpoint(), "TR.feedIdDoesNotReferToEndpoint" );

con:assertion.name: Response equals response from test step 'Get Dataset Feed'

con:testCase.name: Download dataset link
con:testCase.con:description:
Test if at least one feed entry is available with at least one link to download a file.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 26: Each 'Dataset Feed' shall contain at least one feed entry containing links to download the pre-defined dataset (e.g. as a GML file).
  • TG Requirement 29: Each feed entry shall contain an Atom 'link' element that links to the pre- defined dataset file described by the entry. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'alternate' and a 'length' attribute (providing the length of the linked resource in octets) shall be provided if possible. Where a dataset is provided in multiple physical files, additional 'link' elements shall be provided in the feed entry, one link for each physical file.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Link download dataset'

con:assertion.name: At least one feed entry is available with at least one link to download a file

con:testStep.name: Get Dataset Feed and check optional length attributes

con:config.name: Get Dataset Feed and check optional length attributes
con:config.con:description: A link "length" attribute (providing the length of the linked resource in octets *) must be provided if possible.

con:testCase.name: Rights element
con:testCase.con:description:
Check that the feed's rights element exists.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 23: The 'rights' element of a 'Dataset Feed' shall contain information about rights or restrictions for that feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Rights element'

con:testCase.name: Title
con:testCase.con:description:
Check that the feed's title is non-empty text.

Known limitations: The ATS states that the test case needs to check wheter the value is 'alphanumeric'. This is inappropriate, since the value can contain characters that are not in the range of A-Z,a-z and 0-9, for instance text strings in greek.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 21: The 'title' element of a 'Dataset Feed' shall be populated with a human readable title for the feed.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Title'

con:testCase.name: Updated element
con:testCase.con:description:
Check if the updated element provides a valid date. The date must not be in the future or before the year 2012.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 24: The 'updated' element of a 'Dataset Feed' shall contain the date, time and timezone at which the feed was last updated.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Updated element'

con:assertion.name: Date is not before the year 2012
Date is not in the future

con:testCase.name: Each entry has CRS information
con:testCase.con:description:
Check that each entry in the Dataset feed one valid category element is provided for the CRS.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 35: Each CRS representation shall have a 'category' element which refers to the CRS definition and code.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Each entry has CRS information'

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element category, including a term and label, to refer to CRSs

con:testCase.name: Language for download link
con:testCase.con:description:
Check that each entry which has more than one download link provides the hreflang attribute to indicate the language of the target dataset.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 31: Where alternative language representations of datasets are linked to, the 'hreflang' attribute of the link element shall be used to indicate the language of the target dataset as described in the Atom specification.
  • TG Requirement 38: Where a feed is made available in alternative languages, links shall be provided to these alternative representations. These links shall each use the 'hreflang' attribute to indicate the language of the alternative representation. The value of the 'rel' attribute for these link elements this element shall be 'alternate'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Language for download link'

con:assertion.name: If an entry has more than 1 download link, test that each of these download links provides the hreflang attribute

con:configuration.scriptText:
import de.interactive_instruments.etf.suim.* import de.interactive_instruments.xtf.* SOAPUI_I.init(log, context, messageExchange) final ProjectHelper ph = new ProjectHelper() final Assert a = new Assert(messageExchange, context, log, Assert.INSPIRE_DS_NS);
a.isTrue( "count(//*:entry/*:link[(@rel='alternate' and @type!='application/atom+xml') or (@rel='section')])=1 or "+ "count(//*:entry/*:link[(@rel='alternate' and @type!='application/atom+xml') or (@rel='section')]/@hreflang) = "+ "count(//*:entry/*:link[(@rel='alternate' and @type!='application/atom+xml') or (@rel='section')])", "TR.missingLanguageForDownloadLink" );

con:testCase.name: Links for Spatial Object Types
con:testCase.con:description:
Test if the dataset feed contains at least one link to a registry



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 28: Each feed shall contain an Atom 'link' element for each INSPIRE Spatial Object Type in the dataset. The link shall refer to the INSPIRE Registry unless the data does not conform to any Data Specification in which case a link to a local definition of the Spatial Object Type shall be used instead. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'describedby'. For definitions in the INSPIRE registry the value of the 'type' attribute shall be 'text/html'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Links for Spatial Object Types'

con:assertion.name: Test if the dataset feed contains at least one link to a registry

con:testCase.name: Multiple links for multiple physical files
con:testCase.con:description:
Test for dataset which are provided in multiple physical files, that each file is linked via a separate link element. Each of these link elements shall have a "rel" value equal to "section".



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 32: Where a dataset is provided in multiple physical files: each file shall be linked to via a separate 'link' element. Each of these 'link' elements shall have a 'rel' value equal to 'section'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Multiple links for multiple physical files'

con:assertion.name: Number of section links must not be exactly 1

con:testCase.name: Separate entries for each format/CRS combination
con:testCase.con:description:
Test that the Dataset Feed contains separate entries for each format/CRS combination in which the pre-defined dataset is made available for download.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 27: Each 'Dataset Feed' shall contain separate entries for each format/CRS combination in which the pre-defined dataset is available to download.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Separate entries for each format/CRS combination'

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks the CRS information.

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element category, including a term and label, to refer to CRSs.

con:config.name: Get Dataset Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Dataset Feed and checks the CRS and alternate link combinations.

con:assertion.name: Exactly one alternate link type per Dataset feed entry
Alternate link types and CRS combinations are unique

con:configuration.path:
<etfTranslate what='TR.uniqueAlternateLinkTypes'>
{

    let $sortedValues := for $entry in //*:entry
    order by $entry/*:category[1]/@term, $entry/*:link[@rel = 'alternate'][1]/@type
    return concat('CRS ', $entry/*:category[1]/@term, ' with type ', $entry/*:link[@rel = 'alternate'][1]/@type, '   ')
    
    let $duplicates := $sortedValues[let $pos := position() return . = $sortedValues[$pos+1]]
    let $duplicateCount := count( $duplicates )
    let $distinctDuplicates := distinct-values( $duplicates )
    
    return if ($duplicateCount > 0) then 
        (<count> { $duplicateCount } </count>,<duplicates> { $distinctDuplicates } </duplicates>) 
        else ()

}
</etfTranslate>

con:assertion.name: Category terms in this Dataset feed exist in the Download Service Feed

con:testCase.name: Use INSPIRE media-types only
con:testCase.con:description:
Test that only media types listed in the INSPIRE media-types register are used.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 30: The 'type' attribute of the link element shall be used to indicate the media type of resource that will be returned if the link is resolved. A valid media type must be used for the value of this attribute; if the media type is not registered with IANA it should still follow the conventions for unregistered media types.
  • TG Requirement 34: Only media types listed in the INSPIRE media-types register shall be used.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Use INSPIRE media-types only'

con:config.name: Get INSPIRE Media Types
con:config.con:description: Get the list of INSPIRE media types from https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/media-types with 'Accept'-Header 'application/atom+xml'

con:config.name: Get INSPIRE Media Subtype
con:config.con:description: Get the list of INSPIRE media sub types with 'Accept'-Header 'application/atom+xml'

con:config.name: Get Dataset Feed
con:config.con:description: Get the Dataset Feed and check if it contains valid INSPIRE media types

con:assertion.name: Only media types listed in the INSPIRE media-types register at https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/media-types/ shall be used

con:testCase.name: Provide guidance for downloading multiple physical files
con:testCase.con:description:
Test that a description of the dataset structure is provided either in an atom "content" element as free text, or in an external document which is the target of another "link" element where a dataset is provided in multiple physical files.



Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 33: Where a dataset is provided in multiple physical files: a description of the dataset structure shall be provided EITHER in an atom 'content' element as free text, OR in an external document which is the target of another 'link' element. Where a 'link' element is used this element shall have a 'rel' value equal to 'alternate' and a suitable media type shall be used for the 'type' value.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'Provide guidance for downloading multiple physical files'

con:property.con:name: feedXml
con:property.con:value:
INSPIRE Download Service Feed: Atom-Feed Digitale Orthophotos Bodenauflsung 20 cm Geobasis NRW geobasis@bezreg-koeln.nrw.de Download des NRW-Datenbestands Digitale Orthophotos Bodenauflsung 20 cm (DOP20) als Atom-Feed. https://www.opengeodata.nrw.de/produkte/geobasis/dop/dop20/c72796a4-71af-421d-8a2e-d220f9de6c94 Nutzungsbedingungen: Ab 01.01.2017 gelten die Lizenzbedingungen Datenlizenz Deutschland - Namensnennung - Version 2.0 bzw. dl-de/by-2-0 (https://www.govdata.de/dl-de/by-2-0) mit den dort geforderten Angaben zum Quellenvermerk. Als Rechteinhaber und Bereitsteller ist Land NRW, sowie das Jahr des Datenbezugs in Klammern, als Datensatz (URI) ist der Ressourcen-Identifikator https://registry.gdi-de.org/id/de.nw/DOP20 anzugeben. Haftungsbeschrnkung - Fr die Kompatibilitt der zur Verfgung gestellten Daten oder eines Dienstes mit den Systemen des Nutzers, die inhaltliche Richtigkeit, eine bestimmte Datenqualitt oder die dauerhafte Bereitstellung wird keine Haftung bernommen. Davon ausgenommen sind Schadensersatzansprche auf Grund einer Verletzung des Lebens, des Krpers und der Gesundheit. Ebenfalls ausgenommen ist die Haftung fr Schden, die auf einer vorstzlichen oder grob fahrlssigen Pflichtverletzung beruhen. Eine ber gesetzliche Schadensersatzansprche hinausgehende Haftung ist ausgeschlossen. 2017-01-16T22:00:00Z INSPIRE Dataset Feed: Digitale Orthophotos Bodenauflsung 20 cm Geobasis NRW geobasis@bezreg-koeln.nrw.de https://www.opengeodata.nrw.de/produkte/geobasis/dop/dop20/c72796a4-71af-421d-8a2e-d220f9de6c94 2017-02-28T22:00:00Z
Hinweis: Diese Daten stehen unter der Datenlizenz Deutschland Namensnennung 2.0, Bereitsteller: Land NRW (2017). Informationen zum korrekten Quellenvermerk finden Sie hier.

Weiterfhrende Informationen:
http://www.bezreg-koeln.nrw.de/brk_internet/geobasis/luftbilderzeugnisse/digitale_orthophotos/index.html
Metadaten im GEOportal.NRW]]> 50.30 5.80 52.60 9.50 DOP20 https://registry.gdi-de.org/id/de.nw

con:assertion.name: M-04##AtomLinkSelf: Feed link to self exists and has proper language references
M-04##req21: Feed id refers to self URL
M-04##req23: Feed updated element exists and contains a date and time
M-04##req24: Feed contains an author name and email address
M-04##req25-28-31: Feed contains at least one entry for data, with a link to the dataset and length set or a section link in case of multiple files.
M-04##req26a: Dataset feeds contain seperate entries for each format/CRS combination. Each entry link for download has one / the same (media)type
M-04##req26b: Dataset feeds contain seperate entries for each format/CRS combination. Each entry has the same CRS category elements
M-04##req27: Feed contains at least one link to Spatial Object descriptions (in text/html)
M-04##req31: If a section link is provided (for multiple files) then there should be more than 1 section link
M-04##req32: If multiple files are provided, then the links shall be of rel='section' and there shall be a content element or alternate link as a description
M-04##req34: Only media types listed in the INSPIRE media-types register at https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/media-types/ shall be used.
M-04##req35: Each entry shall have an element category for the CRS
Response starts within 30 seconds (using HTTP HEAD)

con:testSuite.name: OpenSearch Description
con:testSuite.con:description:
Test module for checking the OpenSearch Description which is referenced by a Service Feed.

Known limitations: Response schema validation is not implemented yet.

con:testCase.name: Get OpenSearch Description link
con:testCase.con:description: Technical Test Case to retrieve and set theURL to the OpenSearch Description. This Test Case depends on the Test Case 'Link to OpenSearch Description document' in the 'Download Service Feed' test module.

con:config.name: Get Service Feed
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and set the URL to the OpenSearch description.

con:testCase.name: Provide languages
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if it provides at least one 'Language' element.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 45: For each language supported by the download service, the OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Language' element that contains the language code. The first 'Language' element shall contain the Default Language.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description provides languages'

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:assertion.name: Description provides at least one Language

con:testCase.name: Get Spatial Dataset operation
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if all "Get Spatial Dataset" operation responses have the same content-type as the media-type in the OpenSearch Description.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 43:The OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Url' element that describes a template URL for the Get Spatial Data Set operation. This template shall accept the INSPIRE parameters 'crs', 'spatial_dataset_identifier_code', 'spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace' and the OpenSearch 'language' parameter. The 'Url' element shall have an attribute 'type' with a value corresponding to the media type of the result and an attribute 'rel' with the value 'results'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description one URL Get Spatial Dataset operation'

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the OpenSearch Description.

con:assertion.name: Description provides at least one "Url" element that describes a template URL for the Get Spatial Data Set operation
At least spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace and spatial_dataset_identifier_code provided

con:testStep.name: Iterate over Get Spatial Dataset URL

con:config.name: Get Spatial Dataset
con:config.con:description: Checks if the content-type of the Get Spatial Dataset response equals the media-type from the Open Search Description document

con:assertion.name: Response content-type equals media-type from Get Spatial Dataset URL

con:testCase.name: Describe Spatial Dataset operation
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if it provides an "Url" element that describes a template URL for the Describe Spatial Data Set operation.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 42: The OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Url' element that describes a template URL for the Describe Spatial Data Set operation. This template shall accept the INSPIRE parameters 'spatial_dataset_identifier_code', 'spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace' and the OpenSearch 'language' parameter. The 'Url' element shall have an attribute 'type' with a value of 'application/atom+xml' and an attribute 'rel' with the value 'describedby'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description URL Describe Spatial Dataset operation'

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the OpenSearch Description.

con:assertion.name: Description provides at least one "Url" element that describes a template URL for the Describe Spatial Data Set operation
At least spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace and spatial_dataset_identifier_code provided

con:testStep.name: Iterate over Describe Spatial Dataset URL

con:config.name: Describe Spatial Dataset
con:config.con:description: Checks if the content-type of the Describe Spatial Dataset response equals 'application/atom+xml'.

con:testCase.name: Query examples for each dataset
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if it provides a Describe Spatial Dataset and Get Spatial Dataset url. For each category CRS from the Describe Spatial Dataset response a Get Spatial Dataset request with the CRS, the provided inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_code and inspire_dls:spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace is invoked.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 44: For each dataset available the OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Query' element that has a 'role' attribute with the value 'example' and 'spatial_dataset_identifier_code' and 'spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace' attributes together containing unique spatial dataset identifier. The value of the 'crs' and 'language' attributes shall be set to the values considered as the default ones by the service provider.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description Query examples for each dataset'

con:testStep.name: Get Spatial Dataset operation link exists
Describe Spatial Dataset operation link exists

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:assertion.name: Description provides at least one "Url" element that describes a template URL for the Get Spatial Data Set operation
At least spatial_dataset_identifier_namespace and spatial_dataset_identifier_code provided

con:testStep.name: Iterate over Describe Spatial Dataset URL

con:config.name: Describe Spatial Dataset
con:config.con:description: Checks if the content-type of the Get Spatial Dataset response equals the media-type from the Open Search Description document

con:assertion.name: Each entry has an element category, including a term and label, to refer to CRSs

con:testStep.name: Iterate over Get Spatial Dataset URL

con:config.name: Get Spatial Dataset
con:config.con:description: Checks if the content-type of the Get Spatial Dataset response equals the media-type from the Open Search Description document

con:assertion.name: HTTP status code 200,206,301,302 or 303 is returned

con:testCase.name: URI to itself
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if it provides a self URL.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 40: The OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Url' element that describes an HTTP URI for the OpenSearch Description document. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'self', the value of the 'type' attribute shall be 'application/opensearchdescription+xml' and the value of the 'template' attribute shall be the HTTP URI of the document.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description URI to itself'

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:assertion.name: Self reference equals URL of requested resource

con:configuration.scriptText:
import de.interactive_instruments.etf.suim.* import de.interactive_instruments.xtf.* SOAPUI_I.init(log, context, messageExchange) final ProjectHelper ph = new ProjectHelper() final Assert a = new Assert(messageExchange, context, log, Assert.INSPIRE_DS_NS);
a.equals( "/os:OpenSearchDescription/os:Url[@rel='self' and @type='application/opensearchdescription+xml']/@template", "/os:OpenSearchDescription/os:Url", messageExchange.getEndpoint(), "TR.incorrectFeedSelfReference" );

con:testCase.name: Generic search queries URL
con:testCase.con:description:
The test case requests the OpenSearch Description document and checks if it provides an "Url" element that describes a template URL for generic search queries. The resource at the URL is retrieved and checked if it returns HTML content.

Relevant Requirements:
  • TG Requirement 41: The OpenSearch description shall contain a 'Url' element that describes a template URL for generic search queries. The value of the 'rel' attribute of this element shall be 'results', the value of the 'type' attribute shall be 'text/html'.


Source: Abstract Test Case 'OpenSearch Description URL generic search queries'

con:config.name: Get OpenSearch Description
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.

con:assertion.name: Description provides a template URL for generic search queries

con:testStep.name: Get resource at generic search quries URL

con:config.name: Get resource at generic search quries URL
con:config.con:description: Requests the Service Feed and checks if the dataset feed links are correct.
